fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Competition, Consumers, Environment, Research and innovation, Food Safety, Climate Action
inter_groups: Biodiversity, countryside, hunting and recreational fisheries
eu_initiatives: Support for beekeeping sector. Regulation of pesticides and GMOs. Free trade negotiations. Adulteration of honey, beeswax and other bee products.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Advisory Group on the Food Chain and Animal and Plant Health#E00860#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=860#Member#C
goals__remit:
The European Professional Beekeepers Association (EPBA) is an association of beekeeping organisations of EU member states. There are no individual memberships. The present and pending member organisations represent most of the professional and semi-professional beekeepers in Europe. Membership has been applied for from other organisations, from affiliated non-EU countries. 
 
The organisation is funded by annual membership dues and functions through membership representatives voluntering their time. 
 
EPBA has sent delegates to EU conferences and has met with representsatives of the EU commission (DG-Agri and DG-Environment).
